definition: apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: Extend your tongue as far as possible to the corner of your mouth while pressing against a tongue depressor.
sentences.chinese: 向嘴角伸长你的舌头顶住压舌器。

sentences.english: After accomplishing those tasks, the paratroopers had to withstand any German counterattacks.
sentences.chinese: 完成这些任务之后，伞兵还必须顶住德军的反攻。

sentences.english: They are able to overcome any voices of doubt and have an extraordinary ability to fight.
sentences.chinese: 他们能顶住任何质疑的声音，并拥有卓越的战斗能力。

sentences.english: Cai Biao suddenly gun against Krishna head, said he was guilty.
sentences.chinese: 蔡彪突然用枪顶住大奎的脑袋，说他是内奸。
向嘴角伸长你的舌头顶住压舌器。

sentences.english: Think you can use them to hold off the attackers for an hour?
sentences.chinese: 预计你们能用她们顶住进攻者一小时吗？

sentences.english: Push arms forward horizontally, raise palms, and push hands to the wall.
sentences.chinese: 把两臂前平举，立掌，手推着墙顶住。

sentences.english: They need to resist this pressure.
sentences.chinese: 他们必须顶住这种压力。

sentences.english: Like an iron bastion, the dam withstood the rushing floodwaters.
sentences.chinese: 大坝好似铜墙铁壁，顶住了洪水的冲击。

sentences.english: Push against your tongue with the flat object/alveolar ridge at the same time as you push against the flat object with your tongue Hold for 1 to 2 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 让你的舌头顶住这个平物坚持1到两秒。

sentences.english: Today, I fell asleep in my last period class.
sentences.chinese: 今天，最后一堂课我终于没顶住，睡过去了。

sentences.english: Someone like Mr. Cronon can stand up to the pressure.
sentences.chinese: 像克罗侬先生这样的人士有能力顶住压力。

sentences.english: The president asked the board to bite the bullet to the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 董事长让董事会要紧牙关顶住这场危机。

sentences.english: Using a finger to resist shrapnel tail light press reset.
sentences.chinese: 用手指顶住弹片尾部轻按可复位。

sentences.english: They stuck a gun in his ribs and made him fork over all his money.
sentences.chinese: 他们把枪顶住他的肋骨，逼他把所有的钱交出来。

sentences.english: But I fended off the taunts and jibes of the family good humouredly.
sentences.chinese: 但我心平气和地顶住了家人的嘲笑和奚落。

definition: to counterattack/to come back after a defeat/to retrieve lost ground
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
to hold on to/to defend/to keep/to guard
to resist/to hold back/to stop/to ward off/to withstand
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
